Inspect.Title: Inspecting Pile Contents
Inspect.NoActor: You are inspecting the contents of this pile without controlling a token, which means you can't take items from it.
Inspect.Destroyed: This pile no longer exists and lies barren.

Errors.NoSourceDrop: You cannot drop items from the item bar unless you are a GM.
Errors.PileTooFar: You're too far away to interact with this pile.
Errors.PileLocked: This item pile is locked and cannot be opened - you can't drop items in it.
Errors.DropNoToken: You don't have a token on this scene, so you can't drop any items here.

DropTypeWarning.Title: Item Type Warning
DropTypeWarning.Content: You're dropping an item that is of a type ("{type}") that is normally not allowed to be dropped. Are you sure you want to do this?

ResetSettings.Title: Reset Item Piles Module Settings
ResetSettings.Content: Are you sure you want to reset all of the Item Piles module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!

LinkedActorWarning.Title: Item Piles & Linked Actor
LinkedActorWarning.Content: Are you sure you want to turn this linked actor into an item pile? This actor's token is linked and all tokens of this actor will share its inventory and attributes.

NoSystemFound.Title: System Not Recognized
NoSystemFound.Content:
This system is not currently fully supported. This means that the module does not know how to best handle this system's items, but can still operate in a limited fashion.

You can configure the module's settings yourself, but it requires a bit of technical know-how.

If you have any questions, ping Wasp#2005 on the Foundry discord.

SystemFound.Title: System Recognized
SystemFound.Content:
This system was previously not supported, but in an recent update it was added as a supported system!

Do you want to load this system's default Item Pile settings?

AttributeEditor.Title: Dynamic Attributes Editor
AttributeEditor.Explanation: Here you can define which attributes on characters that can be picked up from item piles, such as currencies. In D&D5e, currencies exist on actors on the attribute path "actor.data.data.currency.gp", so you'd add your own with the name "Gold Coins" and attribute path "data.currency.gp".
AttributeEditor.Name: Attribute name

Defaults.Title: Item Pile Configuration
Defaults.EnabledPileExplanation: Whether this should act as an item pile.
Defaults.InspectItemsExplanation: Clicking item names will open the item's sheet.
Defaults.ItemTypeFilterExplanation: Items of these types will not be shown in any item pile UI, each type separated by a comma. Leave blank to use module defaults.
Defaults.MacroExplanation: Name of macro to execute when this pile is interacted with.
Defaults.OverrideAttributesExplanation: Configure if this pile should be able to transfer other attributes than the default.
Defaults.DeleteWhenEmptyExplanation: Causes the item pile to auto-delete itself once it's empty.
Defaults.DisplayOneExplanation: If the pile is made up of a single item, this sets the pile token's image to be the image of the item.

DropItem.Title: Dropping Item
DropItem.ExistingPiles: There's already an item pile at this location, you will add your item(s) to this pile.
DropItem.QuantityToDrop: You have {quantity} of this item, how many do you want to drop?

Reset.Title: Reset settings to default
Reset.Label: Reset Item Piles Settings To Default
Reset.Hint: This will reset all of the settings of Item Piles back to the active game system's default.

ActorClass.Title: Actor class type
ActorClass.Label: This setting defines the type of actor that will be used for the default item pile actor that is created on first item drop. In the case of D&D5e, this is "character", as it does not have a dedicated loot actor type.

Quantity.Title: Item quantity attribute
Quantity.Label: Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each item's quantity. For example, in D&D5e system, each item's quantity is stored in the item's "item.data.data.quantity" attribute, so you'd put "data.quantity" in this setting.

Attributes.Title: Dynamic Attributes
Attributes.Label: Configure Attributes
Attributes.Hint: This setting define the attributes that are eligible for pickup in item paths, such as currencies or power, which may not be actual items.

ItemType.Title: Item type attribute
ItemType.Label: This setting defines the attribute path for determining where the item types live. In D&D5e, it's just "type" because the type is defined directly in "item.data.type", because each item distinguishes its type with that attribute.

ItemTypeFilters.Title: Item type filters
ItemTypeFilters.Label: Here you can configure what item types are ignored and not listed in the item pile dialogs. For example, in D&D5e we probably don't want to show spells, feats, and classes, so you'd put "spell, feat, class".

DeleteEmptyPiles.Title: Auto-delete empty piles
DeleteEmptyPiles.Label: This causes item piles to delete themselves once they run out of items. This can be overridden on individual item piles.

PreloadFiles.Title: Preload Files
PreloadFiles.Label: Causes files (images and audio) of piles to be preloaded, resulting in a seamless experience.

Debug.Title: Enable debugging
Debug.Label: Prints debug messages to the console
